tool.name: make library id lists
tool.command:
make_library_id_lists.py -i $input_fasta #if str($screened_rep_seqs) != 'None': -s $screened_rep_seqs #end if
#if str($otus) != 'None': -u $otus #end if -o make_library_id_lists_output #if $field: -f $field #end if
#if $debug: --debug #end if ; compress_path.py -i make_library_id_lists_output -o $outdir

param.label: -i/--input_fasta: The path to a FASTA file containing input sequences
param.name: input_fasta

param.label: -s/--screened_rep_seqs: The path to a FASTA file containing screened representative seqs[DEFAULT: None]
param.name: screened_rep_seqs

param.label: -u/--otus: The path to an OTU file mapping OTUs onto rep seqs[DEFAULT: None]
param.name: otus

param.label: -f/--field: Index of space-delimited field to read id from [DEFAULT: 1]
param.name: field

tool.help: Makes a list of the ids corresponding to each library represented in the input fasta file. Assumes that the libraries are the output of split_libraries.py and that they contain the 454 read id for each sequence as is standard in the split_libraries.py output. Produces a separate file for each library. This script produces a separate file for each library.
